title: Paul’s Final Instructions
shortSummary: In 1 Corinthians 16, Paul gives practical instructions regarding the collection for the saints, his travel plans, and encouragement for steadfastness in faith. He emphasizes unity, love, and the importance of supporting faithful servants within the church. The chapter closes with personal greetings and a solemn warning for those who reject Christ.
timeline: c. AD 57 - Paul’s Third Missionary Journey, during his stay in Ephesus

keyCharacters.name: Paul
keyCharacters.description: The apostle writing this letter, providing guidance and encouragement to the Corinthian church.

keyCharacters.name: Timotheus (Timothy)
keyCharacters.description: Paul’s trusted co-worker, sent to encourage the Corinthians and urged to be received without fear.

keyCharacters.name: Apollos
keyCharacters.description: A gifted preacher who desired to visit the Corinthians later when convenient.

keyCharacters.name: Stephanas
keyCharacters.description: Leader of the first converts in Achaia who devoted themselves to ministering to the saints.

keyCharacters.name: Fortunatus and Achaicus
keyCharacters.description: Brethren who came to Paul and refreshed his spirit, also commended for their service to the church.

definitions.definition: A financial offering gathered by the churches to support believers in Jerusalem facing hardship.
A strong apostolic curse meaning 'accursed, our Lord comes,' expressing judgment on those who do not love Christ.
The initial and best portion of a harvest offered to God, symbolizing dedication and priority.
A customary greeting among early Christians symbolizing love, unity, and fellowship.

outline.heading: Instructions on the Collection for the Saints
outline.description: Paul instructs the Corinthians to set aside offerings weekly for the needy believers in Jerusalem, emphasizing orderly giving and trustworthy representatives to deliver the gifts.

outline.heading: Paul’s Travel Plans and Ministry Update
outline.description: Paul outlines his intended travel through Macedonia and Ephesus, encourages the church to receive Timothy without fear, and notes Apollos’ delayed visit.

outline.heading: Exhortations to Faithfulness and Love
outline.description: Paul urges the believers to be watchful, stand firm in faith, act courageously, and do all things with love.

outline.heading: Commendation of Stephanas and Fellow Workers
outline.description: Paul commends Stephanas, Fortunatus, and Achaicus for their devoted ministry and encourages the church to acknowledge and submit to faithful servants.

outline.heading: Final Greetings and Benediction
outline.description: Paul sends greetings from various churches, instructs the Corinthians to greet one another with a holy kiss, pronounces a solemn warning on those who do not love Christ, and closes with a blessing of grace and love.

application: Regularly set aside resources to support the needs of fellow believers and the work of the church.
Welcome and support faithful Christian workers and leaders without fear or contempt.
Stand firm in your faith, be courageous in your walk with Christ, and let love guide all your actions.
Value and encourage those who serve diligently in ministry, recognizing their spiritual refreshment to the body.

keyVerses.text: Watch ye, stand fast in the faith, quit you like men, be strong.
keyVerses.significance: A powerful call to vigilance, steadfastness, courage, and strength in the Christian life.

keyVerses.text: Let all your things be done with charity.
keyVerses.significance: Emphasizes that love must be the motivating principle behind all Christian actions.

keyVerses.text: If any man love not the Lord Jesus Christ, let him be Anathema Maranatha.
keyVerses.significance: A solemn apostolic warning highlighting the seriousness of rejecting Christ.

keyVerses.text: Upon the first day of the week let every one of you lay by him in store, as God hath prospered him, that there be no gatherings when I come.
keyVerses.significance: Establishes the early Christian practice of weekly giving in proportion to God’s blessing.
